full_description: Use the right arm to press the bell in a rhythmic pattern of short-long-short clicks. The arm must lower to contact the bell, perform a brief press, then a sustained hold, and finally another brief press.
schema: {A} notifies the bell, {a} notifies the right arm
preference: No adjectives at the end. Max 15 words. Use {A} for bell. Include {a} for arm in exactly 50% of instructions. Use verbs like press, hold, and tap.
seen: Use {a} to click {A} following a short-long-short rhythmic pattern.
Press {A} in a rhythmic pattern of short-long-short clicks.
Direct {a} to press {A} briefly, then hold, then tap again.
Follow the rhythm to click {A} briefly, hold, then tap.
Make {a} ring {A} twice quickly with one long press between.
Complete the sequence on {A} with two quick and one long press.
Command {a} to execute the rhythmic clicks on {A} as shown.
Trigger {A} twice with a brief touch and once with a hold.
Control {a} to hit {A} in a short-long-short rhythmic pattern.
Tap {A} using the specific short-long-short rhythmic timing.
Let {a} finish the rhythmic task by pressing {A} three times.
Perform three rhythmic presses on {A} to finish the cycle.
Direct {a} to tap {A}, hold the position, and tap again.
Execute a sequence of short, long, and short presses on {A}.
Use {a} to ring {A} by alternating quick and sustained pressure.
Ring {A} by alternating between quick taps and a sustained press.
Employ {a} to complete the short-long-short sequence on {A}.
Follow the timing to strike {A} with varying press durations.
Sequence {a} to press {A} once briefly, once long, then once briefly.
Apply one brief, one long, and one final brief press to {A}.
unseen: Use {a} to rotate through short and long presses on {A}.
Finish the rhythmic pattern on {A} for one full cycle.
Direct {a} to follow the rhythmic press intervals on {A}.
Complete the three-step rhythmic press on {A} for success.
